result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane J Cataldo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: Complete high school education.  Obtain and maintain employment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including relapse prevention counseling.  Absolute sobriety is required.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate including cognitive behavior therapy.  No contact with named victims or co-actors.  Reside with mother until such time as mother and agent approve of alternate residence.  No driving unless properly licensed.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Expungment authorized upon successful completion of probation on the Bail jumping charge only.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

BTC: Motions in Limine, proposed verdict form and customized jury instrustions to be filed by March 1st @ 5pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Must reside in his mothers home at 2332 Gillen Street Racine WI. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. No contact with the victim or co defendant (person, property, residence or family). Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
